title: Cholera and the Map That Saved London
description: One-minute skill: Cholera and the Map That Saved London.

hook.text: In 1854, cholera was killing hundreds in London. A doctor made a map and solved the mystery.

buildup.text: John Snow plotted every cholera death on a map of Soho. A terrifying cluster appeared around one water pump.

discovery.text: He convinced authorities to remove the pump handle. Deaths dropped almost immediately.

twist.text: Doctors at the time believed diseases spread through bad air. Snow's data proved it was contaminated water.

climax.text: His map invented epidemiology â€” the science of tracking disease patterns. Every outbreak map traces back to Snow.

punchline.text: One map, one pump handle, and modern public health was born.
